intro: Nothoscordum fictile, commonly known as the false garlic, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its grass-like foliage and umbel-shaped flower clusters. The plant produces white or pale purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its bulbous root system resembles that of true garlic, leading to its common name. Nothoscordum fictile is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its attractive appearance and ease of cultivation.
